chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Cooney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[JK] cases called at 1:22pm
Patrick J Cooney appears by phone.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin
Probation Agent, Amy Coates, is present.

ADA Shock and Agent Coates make recommendations that the Court extend Probation by 1 year.
Mr. Cooney makes statement.
The Court reviews the payment history.
The Court orders that Probation is extended for 1 year, indicating to Mr. Cooney that if pays the financial amount due earlier than the one year, then Mr. Cooney can be discharged early upon that payment.
Ms. Coates indicates that the current amount due is $716.

from DOC Agent requesting Probation be extended

From defendant requesting permission to do CSW work
Request for huber is denied
JCJ Inmate request form re: request for Huber privileges for work

Case called at 9:33 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Patrick J Cooney in court, in custody. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that matter was scheduled for hearing in response to Defendant's note to the Court from 7/2/14. Probation Agent sent an order requesting the Court impose the 60 days of the 6 months conditional jail, request was granted.
Mr. Cooney informs the Court that he is requesting a furlough day to make payments for rent and to gather personal property, do not have any family here in Jefferson to take care of those matters.
ADA Beck presents arguments in opposition of request
Court presents basis and denies Defendant's request for furlough
Recess: 9:39 am
Clerk's Response to Def. inquiry re: 7/14/14 hearing. - Mr. Cooney, Appears the Court set the hearing in response to your 7/2/14 letter request for exercising Huber privileges
from Def. re: inquiring what the 7/14/14 hearing is for
in response to Defendant's 7/2/14 Letter; Hearing to be set
Hearing on July 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Two Letter from the defendant requesting huber
The Court imposes 60 days of the initial 6 months that were stayed as a condition of probation, beginning the day this order is endorsed, with release privileges for AODA
Proposed ATR Order filed by DOC
Assessment report
Associated with Charge #1

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With elements/ criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF20 & 14CM24 called together at 1:40 pm [Cases were scheduled for STC]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV] 
Defendant Patrick J Cooney in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF20: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Cooney waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:-service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Charge in each case; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Sentencing arguments by Counsel; Statement by Henry Showalter

On Charge in 14CF20 & 14CM24, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (14CF20); STAYED - TO BE USED IF THERE ARE VIOLATIONS ON PROBATION AND MUST APPLY TO THE COURT TO USE THAT JAIL TIME 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To pay costs of $268 (14CF20)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF20)
--To pay costs of $243 (14CM24)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CM24)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CM24)
--To pay restitution of $1100 payable to Henry M. Showalter (14CF20)
--To pay $110 restitution processing fee (14CF20)

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Defendant's
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Status conference on February 21, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2014 at 08:40 am.
Scheduling notice
Bond to cover 14CF20 & 14CM24

Cases 14CF20 & 14CM24 called at 1:25 pm
Defendant Patrick J Cooney in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on each criminal complaint are correct.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.

14CF20:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.

14CM24:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.

Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond to cover both files, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No presence at the Kwik Trip Store in Jefferson located at 102 Colloins Rd.
-No direct or indirect contact with Henry Schowalter, Antonio Young or Frieda Cooney

Recess: 1:39 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 2/5/14 at 8:40 am (as to both cases)
Status: 2/21/14 at 2:00 pm (as to both cases)
